Question: When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.
In addition to checking it is safe to move out from the kerb into the traffic flow, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Accelerate quickly into the traffic flow
Move slowly into a space in the traffic flow

Question: This sign means the speed for safe and comfortable driving around the curve is 35km/h.
A police officer has the power to arrest you for:

Answers.Answer: failing to supply your correct name and address
having no warrant of fitness for your vehicle
failing to signal a right turn
failing to stop at a stop sign

Question: You can stop or park your vehicle over a fire hydrant if someone stays with the vehicle who can move it.
You have a restricted licence. A condition for driving at night without a supervisor is that you MUST NOT drive between:
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
If you tow another vehicle, what is the maximum distance allowed between the two vehicles?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You can be fined if your vehicle is on a road and not up to warrant of fitness standard.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You are driving in a 100km/h speed area and you see an Accident sign. What speed must you slow down to?
What is the purpose of the 2-second rule?

Answers.Answer: To provide a safe following distance between vehicles traveling at the same speed
To ensure that vehicles have sufficient stopping time when approaching intersections
To avoid gridlocks in congested driving areas
To ensure the speed limit is observed

Question: When coming up to a roundabout you must give way to all vehicles that will cross your path from your left.
The bonnet of your vehicle lifts up while you are driving and you cannot see. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Turn your vehicle headlights on and look out of the side window
Brake smoothly and move over to the left side of the road
Steer your vehicle straight ahead and stop as quickly as you can
Speed up and move to the left side of the road

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When driving on an unlaned road, where should your vehicle be positioned?

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
Close to the centre of the road
As close to the left side of the road as possible

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When should you use your hazard lights?

Answers.Answer: When your vehicle becomes a temporary hazard to other road users
When approaching an accident scene to warn other drivers
When reversing from a driveway and your view is not clear

Question: A warrant of fitness is to show:

Answers.Answer: the year the vehicle was made
if the driver has had any crashes
how many times the vehicle has crashed
that the vehicle was roadworthy at the time of checking

Question: What does a blue reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road

Question: If you are driving at night with your vehicle headlights on high beam, when MUST you dip them?

Answers.Answer: Approaching a police officer on point duty

Question: When should you apply the 4-second rule?

Answers.Answer: Never. You should only use the 2-second rule
In wet, frosty or icy road conditions
When waiting for any vehicles coming over a one-way bridge

Question: When are you allowed to pass another vehicle?

Answers.Answer: When you are coming up to a blind corner or blind bend
When a vehicle has stopped at a pedestrian crossing
When you can see at least 100 metres of clear road in front of you once you have finished passing
When you are less than 10 metres away from a railway level crossing

Question: You MUST dip the headlights on your vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: changing lanes in a one way street
changing lanes to exit the motorway

Question: What is shown by a white reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road
The far right side of the road

Question: Can you stop on a bus stop in a private motor vehicle?

Answers.Answer: Only if it is for less than 5 minutes

Question: You must NOT open the door of your motor vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: you are parked within 10 metres of a bus stop
you are likely to scratch the paint of your vehicle
the car radio in your vehicle is playing loud music
you are likely to hurt any person

Question: You wish to make a right turn on a narrow country road. There is a vehicle coming towards you and traffic behind you. What is the safest option?

Answers.Answer: Wait in the centre of the road and turn when it is clear
Drive straight ahead and do a U-turn when the road is clear
Decide not to turn and drive straight ahead
Move to the left side of the road and turn when the road is clear

Question: You see a pedestrian carrying a white cane crossing the road. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Rev the engine to let them know that you are waiting
Take extra care and allow them to cross the road in their own time
Turn on the vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Speed up and pass in front of them

Question: What must you do at an intersection controlled by a Stop sign?

Answers.Answer: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Stop only if you can do so safely
Continue driving unless you can see an oncoming vehicle

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp
